meta_info.name: LOCATABLE
meta_info.description: Root class of all information model classes that can be archetyped. Most classes in the openEHR reference model inherit from the `LOCATABLE` class, which defines the idea of  locatability in an archetyped structure. `LOCATABLE` defines a runtime name and an `_archetype_node_id_`.

functions.name: concept
functions.meaning: Clinical concept of the archetype as a whole (= derived from the archetype_node_id' of the root node)

functions.name: is_archetype_root
functions.meaning: True if this node is the root of an archetyped structure.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Runtime name of this fragment, used to build runtime paths. This is the term provided via a clinical application or batch process to name this EHR construct: its retention in the EHR faithfully preserves the original label by which this entry was known to end users.

attributes.name: archetype_node_id
attributes.description: Design-time archetype identifier of this node taken from its generating archetype; used to build archetype paths. Always in the form of an at-code, e.g.  `at0005`. This value enables a 'standardised' name for this node to be generated, by referring to the generating archetype local terminology.

attributes.name: uid
attributes.description: Optional globally unique object identifier for root points of archetyped structures.

attributes.name: links
attributes.description: Links to other archetyped structures (data whose root object inherits from `ARCHETYPED`, such as `ENTRY`, `SECTION` and so on). Links may be to structures in other compositions.

attributes.name: archetype_details
attributes.description: Details of archetyping used on this node.

attributes.name: feeder_audit
attributes.description: Audit trail from non-openEHR system of original commit of information forming the content of this node, or from a conversion gateway which has synthesised this node.
